instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00244 no display and no backlight
threads.message:
Hi,
i got a A1534 (820-00244) that came with no backlight. When I opened it i saw that it was opened before and the lcd connector on the board was ripped off and backlight fuse was replaced.
So Replaced the lcd connector then i got an image but no backlight. 
After some measurements around U8401 I suddenly don't get an image anymore but the system is still booting I already checked the LCD connector bit it looks soldered good.
PP5V_S0S2 is going up for a sec when plugging it in.

threads.title: 820-00244 no display and no backlight
threads.message:
DP_INT_HPD pulses at same time?

I bet for bad contacts.
Did you try known good LCD assembly?

threads.title: 820-00244 no display and no backlight
threads.message:
unforunately DP_INT_HDP is not accessible (hidden behind cpu glue).

I resoldered the connector 2 times now and double checked the contact but i got the same result.
Unforunately i dont have a known good LCD for this model...

threads.title: 820-00244 no display and no backlight
threads.message:
The signal comes from LCD; need to test with known good one.
Must go high at same time when 3V3/5V_S0SW_LCD appear.
